text:
At the heart of the catacombs lies an ancient altar, worn smooth by centuries of ashfall. The bonfire here barely flickers, a memory of fire rather than fire itself. When you approach, it sputters. When you kneel, it flares.

Visions seize youâ€”armies drowning in flame, cities built atop the corpses of dragons, and a crown that screams when worn. The flame whispers one word into your soul: 'Return.' Then, silence. You are alone again, save for the warmth that now kindles beneath your skin.
lore: This tombfire was lit in the Age of Bloom, when the flame was first deemed a curse. It has not gone out since. Many have tried to extinguish it. All failed. It does not burn wood. It burns remembrance.
